title: Cameron Diaz cuts a casual figure in a denim jacket as she goes grocery shopping in Beverly Hills
text:
She has chosen a low-key life of wedded bliss after retiring from acting.

And Cameron Diaz cut a casual figure in a blue denim jacket and red shades as she stepped out for a spot of grocery shopping at Whole Foods in Beverly Hills, California on Friday.

The actress, 47, looked relaxed and care-free as she picked up a number of no doubt healthy food items from her local store.

Chilled: Cameron Diaz cut a casual figure in a blue denim jacket as she stepped out for a spot of grocery shopping at Whole Foods in Beverly Hills, California on Friday

Cameron teamed her distressed jacket with a plain white T-shirt and camel cargo trousers.

The star rounded off her low-key attire with a simple pair of sandals, but added a touch of glam with a pair of over-sized red sunglasses.

The Charlie's Angel's star swept her blonde tresses into a high ponytail, while she allowed her natural beauty to shine though by going make-up free for the outing.

Cameron didn't appear to have a care in the world as she casually strolled around the store, armed with her essentials.

Laid back: The actress, 47, looked relaxed and care-free as she picked up a number of no doubt healthy food items from her local store

Cameron's most recent film was the 2014 remake of Annie, in which she played Miss Hannigan, the role originated in 1976 on Broadway by Dorothy Loudon and popularized further in the 1982 movie by comedy icon Carol Burnett.

Last March, she described herself as 'actually retired' in an Entertainment Weekly retrospective interview about her 2002 film The Sweetest Thing.

The wife of Benji Madden was looking back on the movie with her co-stars Selma Blair and Christina Applegate, and the subject of a potential reunion came up.

Happy couple: Cameron has chosen a low-key life of wedded bliss with husband Benji Madden, after retiring from acting

'I'm literally doing nothing, too! I'm semi-retired, I haven't worked for years. I'm a mom, that's what we do. So I'm around, man,' said Christina.

Cameron piped up: 'That's so awesome. I'm totally down. I'm semi-retired, too, and I am actually retired, so I would love to see you ladies.'

By autumn, however, Variety announced a reboot of the Shrek franchise and quoted producer Chris Meledandri saying he wanted to reuse the original cast.

'When you look back on those vocal performances they're awesome, and while you certainly could make a case for a complete reinvention, I find myself responding to my own nostalgic feelings of wanting to go back to those characterizations,' he said.
description: The actress, 47, cut a casual figure  in a blue denim jacket as she stepped out for a spot of grocery shopping at Whole Foods in Beverly Hills, California on Friday.
